intro: Lychnis neglecta, commonly known as the common sandwort, is a low-growing flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters and features slender, branched stems covered in small, scale-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, pink or red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its flowers are usually arranged in racemes and are characterized by their five petals and prominent stamens. Lychnis neglecta thrives in moist, sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
